roleset.name: asking price

roles.note: Commodity and buyer can be hard to distinguish, especially if thepreposition is "for". Try substituting in "to"; it will work forbuyer but not for commodity.

example.name: price and buyer
example.text: [Traditional stock managers]-1 like *trace*-1 to charge higher fees for smaller investors.

example.name: all args
example.text: The Penn Bookstore charged John $100 for a mechanical pencil.

roleset.note: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls bill-54.5.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: John recklessly charged down the crowded street.

example.name: with arg0
example.text: Rupert charged his horse across and into Ireton.

example.name: metaphorical batteries
example.text: John (re)charged his batteries with a quadruple shot of espresso.
example.arg: with a quadruple shot of espresso

example.name: all args
example.text: During the third quarter, the company charged about $46 million against earnings in reducing goodwill.

example.name: usually as crime
example.text: Royal Business Group Inc. said [it]-1 filed suit in federal court here *trace*-1 charging Realist Inc. and its directors with violating federal securities laws ``by engaging in a scheme to prevent'' Royal from acquiring Realist.
example.arg: with violating federal securities laws ``by engaging in a scheme to prevent'' Royal from acquiring Realist

example.name: passivized crime
example.text: [Mr. Antar]-2 was charged *trace*-2 last month in a civil suit filed in federal court in Newark by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
example.arg: in a civil suit filed in federal court in Newark by the Securities and Exchange Commission

example.name: not a crime
example.text: Instead, [an appropriate institution]*-4 should be charged [*-4] with the job of preventing chaos in the market: the Federal Reserve.
example.arg: with the job of preventing chaos in the market

roleset.name: allege (an utterance or complement clause)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Pharmacia, based in Upsala, Sweden, had charged in a lawsuit against MedChem that MedChem's AMVISC product line infringes on the Pharmacia patent.
example.arg: that MedChem's AMVISC product line infringes on the Pharmacia patent

roleset.note: No VNcls. This is clearly closely related to the "charge with a crime" sense, but the syntax is completely different.

roleset.name: charge off: emit hastily(?)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The bank charged off $53 million in loans during the quarter.

roleset.note: Seems to be equivalent to 'discharge'. No VNcls.
